wordpressWpDailyReads.title: Daily Reads 6/28/2019
wordpressWpDailyReads.content:
Happy Friday, everyone. U.S. consumer spending in the first quarter was even weaker than previously reported. Apple today announced that Sir Jony Ive, Apple’s chief design officer, will depart the company. Montgomery County Executive Marc Elrich, during a Tuesday discussion with the County Council on economic development, said to attract more entrepreneurs, officials will have to solve the county’s declining demand for commercial office space. Years before two Boeing 737 Max jets crashed in Indonesia and Ethiopia, U.S. regulators found a pattern of recurring safety problems with the manufacturing giant. And to help with financial stress, check out a blog that explores how you can make the most of your money to gain happiness.

 

ECONOMY

U.S. First-Quarter Consumer Spending Revised Down to 0.9% Gain

U.S. consumer spending in the first quarter was even weaker than previously reported on lower outlays for services while business investment was revised higher, leaving the pace of economic growth at a still-solid 3.1%.

 

TECHNOLOGY

Jony Ive to form independent design company with Apple as client

Cupertino, California — Apple today announced that Sir Jony Ive, Apple’s chief design officer, will depart the company as an employee later this year to form an independent design company which will count Apple among its primary clients. While he pursues personal projects, Ive in his new company will continue to work closely and on a range of projects with Apple.

 

TRANSPORTATION

Long before the Max disasters, Boeing had a history of failing to fix safety problems

Years before two Boeing 737 Max jets crashed in Indonesia and Ethiopia, U.S. regulators found a pattern of recurring safety problems with the manufacturing giant.

 

PERSONAL DEVELOPMENT

Get Happy

How can you get the maximum happiness from the dollar you have? Read this blog on how you can rethink money, and what you can do with it.
